holidays.name: Newspaper Carrier Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the hardworking paper carriers who get the news to your doorstep bright and early!
holidays.origin: Commemorates the first newspaper delivery boy, Barney Flaherty, who was hired in 1833.
holidays.funFact: The phrase "Extra! Extra! Read all about it!" is said to have originated from these early newspaper carriers shouting headlines on the streets.

holidays.name: Tattoo Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the art of tattooing, a practice that has fascinated and adorned humans for thousands of years!
holidays.origin: Observed on September 4 to honor the evolving culture and history of tattoos around the world.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known tattoos were found on Ötzi the Iceman, dating back over 5,000 years!

holidays.name: Eat an Extra Dessert Day
holidays.description: Indulge yourself guilt-free by enjoying an extra dessert today. Because life’s too short to skip the sugar!
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday encouraging sweet tooths to treat themselves.
holidays.funFact: Studies suggest that indulging occasionally in sweets can boost your mood and creativity.

holidays.name: National Wildlife Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about endangered animals and wildlife conservation efforts.
holidays.origin: Founded by wildlife advocate Steve Irwin’s family to honor his passion and legacy.
holidays.funFact: The day is used globally to promote the rescue, rehabilitation, and preservation of wildlife habitats.
